required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Cerianna PET/CT on Treatment Decisions in Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Cerianna PET/CT Results on the Therapeutic Decision in Patients With Known or Suspected Metastatic Breast Cancer With ER-Positive and HER2-Negative Primary Lesions

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multi-center study in the United States to evaluate the impact of Cerianna PET/CT results on the clinical management of patients with known or suspected metastatic breast cancer (MBC). By showing whether breast cancer lesions express estrogen receptor (ER), a Cerianna PET/CT scan may guide the physician in choosing the best treatment options for certain patients.
Patients who receive either 1st line standard-of-care hormonal therapy or 2nd line standard-of-care hormonal therapy for a primary lesion characterized as ER-positive and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-negative will be included in the study. Each patient will undergo screening within 30 days before the Cerianna PET/CT scan to determine whether the patient meets all the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria. After screening, a standardized questionnaire will be completed by the treating physician to evaluate the planned treatment before the Cerianna PET/CT scan. The planned treatment will be evaluated again by the same treating physician within 3 weeks after the Cerianna PET/CT scan using a similar questionnaire. Patients will be followed for 12 months to evaluate the actual treatment undertaken, their clinical status and the results of standard-of-care investigations at 6 months and 12 months after the Cerianna PET/CT scan. Patients will be asked to complete a few questionnaires related to their experience with Cerianna PET/CT. Maximum duration of follow-up for each patient: 14 months. First patient first visit to last patient last visit: Estimated 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate change in therapeutic management plan assessed by comparing pre/post-Cerianna PET/CT treatment selection (based on comparison of the initial management plan and post-Cerianna PET/CT management plan evaluated within 3 weeks).
primary_outcome.time_frame: [Time Frame: Baseline and within 3 weeks after Cerianna PET/CT
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects with changes in the therapeutic management plan after Cerianna PET/CT with 95% confidence interval will be estimated by comparison of the initial management plan vs. the post-Cerianna PET/CT management plan evaluated within 3 weeks after Cerianna PET/CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the change in therapeutic management plan assessed by comparing pre- and post-Cerianna PET/CT treatment selection to the actual treatment at 6 months and at 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: [Time Frame: Baseline, 6 months and 12 months after the Cerianna PET/CT scan]
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects with changes in actual therapeutic management after Cerianna PET/CT will be provided by comparison of the initial and post-Cerianna PET/CT management plans vs. the actual therapeutic management documented at 6-month and 12-month follow-up visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine rates of major and minor therapeutic modifications based on Cerianna PET/CT at 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: [Time Frame: Baseline, 6 months and 12 months after the Cerianna PET/CT scan]
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects with major and minor therapeutic management changes after Cerianna PET/CT will be summarized at 6-month and 12-month follow up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine heterogeneity of receptor expression at lesion level in individual patients, defined as inter-lesion variability in Cerianna uptake in ER-positive tumors in individual patients as assessed by standardized uptake values (SUVs)
secondary_outcome.description: Tumoral SUV based on Cerianna uptake in ER-positive tumors will be summarized by mean, standard deviation, median, Q1, Q3, minimum, and maximum for each subject at before or after the Cerianna PET/CT exam.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare patients' experience of Cerianna PET/CT to that of biopsy taken no more than 1 month before or after the PET/CT exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: [Time Frame: Cerianna PET/CT scan visit and 6-month follow up visit]
secondary_outcome.description: The evaluation of patients' satisfaction of Cerianna PET/CT scan compared to that of biopsy taken before or after the Cerianna PET/CT scan will be provided.

intervention.description: Administration of one dose of 18F FES for PET/CT imaging

study_pop.textblock: Patients with known or Suspected Metastatic Breast Cancer with ER-Positive and HER2-Negative Primary Lesions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient must sign informed consent prior to enrollment in this trial
- The patient is a female ≥18 years old
- Post-menopausal or pre-menopausal patient with known primary breast tumor(s) expressing ER in ≥1% of tumor cells by IHC
- HER2-negative (0, 1+, 2+ fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) negative) primary lesion
- Known or suspected MBC with at least 1 identifiable lesion on conventional imaging assessment, outside of the liver, as confirmed by the investigator site
- Patient with known MBC or suspected MBC that meets one of the following:
- Known MBC with no prior treatment
- Patient with known MBC after 1st line or 2nd line hormone therapy with or without a CDK4 inhibitor or mTOR inhibitor or PI3K inhibitor
- Patient with suspected MBC who is intended to receive either 1st line standard-of-care therapy or receive 2nd line standard-of-care therapy
- Patient must score at least 0, 1 or 2 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
- Life expectancy of at least 12 months
- The patient must have undergone a conventional imaging scan (according to National Comprehensive Cancer Network guidelines, e.g., CT and/or bone scan) covering chest, abdomen, and pelvis no more than 45 days before screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Isolated hepatic metastases (taking into account the physiological hepatic high uptake of Cerianna)
- Patient is on tamoxifen and fulvestrant treatment without 8- and 28-weeks washout, respectively, (may block ER) before Cerianna PET/CT
- Other evolutive malignant disease or acute or chronic infectious disease
- Patient has a history of >1 line of administered chemotherapy for metastatic disease and has not been off chemotherapy for a minimum of 2 weeks; prior chemotherapy in the adjuvant setting is allowed
- Patient with a known allergy to any of the components of Cerianna
- Woman of childbearing age who is not using effective contraception
- Pregnant woman (per the Product Label and ensured using clinic's standard-of-care), or parturient or nursing mother
- Patient presents with any other clinically active, serious, life-threatening disease, medical, or psychiatric condition, and/or who has a life expectancy of <12 months, or for whom study participation may compromise their management; and/or a patient who the investigator judges to be unsuitable for participation in the study for any reason
- Inability to comply with any requirements of the protocol
